download.title: Get Started
download.subtitle: Free, open source, and built with care.
install_steps: Visit Chrome Web Store or Edge Add-ons Store
Or grab the source code for manual install
Open your browser extensions page (chrome://extensions/ or edge://extensions/)
For source install: enable developer mode, load unpacked
You're ready. Start copying clean URLs.

items.question: How do I install this?
items.answer: One click from Chrome Web Store or Edge Add-ons. Or download the source from GitHub if you prefer manual installation. Takes 30 seconds either way.

items.question: What does 'smart cleaning' actually do?
items.answer: It strips out tracking junk—UTM tags, Facebook trackers, Google Analytics parameters. Keeps the parameters that matter for the page to work. Automatically.

items.question: Can I customize the copy format?
items.answer: Absolutely. Use 11 variable fields like {{url}}, {{title}}, {{hostname}}, {{date}}, {{time}} to build your perfect template. For Markdown, plain text, whatever you need.

items.question: How does batch copying work?
items.answer: Select multiple tabs. Click once. Get all URLs copied, filtered, and deduplicated. Choose your export format. Done.

items.question: Is this free?
items.answer: Yes. Free forever, open source, no limits, no subscriptions. Use everything.

items.question: Which browsers work?
items.answer: Chrome, Edge, and any Chromium-based browser with Manifest V3 support. If you're reading this on one of those, you're good.

items.question: Can I use keyboard shortcuts?
items.answer: Ctrl+Shift+C (Cmd+Shift+C on Mac) for silent copying. Or right-click, or use the popup. Whatever matches your flow.

items.question: How do I configure keyboard shortcuts?
items.answer: After installing the extension, type chrome://extensions/shortcuts in your address bar, find Arclet Copier, and assign a shortcut for silent copying, such as Cmd+Shift+C (Ctrl+Shift+C on Windows).
